hypothesis_content.title: Front-Week Volatility Expansion Ahead of Macro Events
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, when the 7-day implied volatility for BTC is less than 110% of the 7-day realized volatility (IV undervalued) and a high-impact US macro event (CPI, FOMC, NFP) is scheduled within 3 trading days, buying short-dated volatility will generate positive returns as IV expands into the event.
hypothesis_content.rationale: In neutral, range-bound markets, short-term implied volatility can become complacent relative to recent realized moves. The scheduled high-impact event creates a known catalyst for volatility, forcing a repricing of short-dated options. The entry filter avoids times when vol is already expensive.
entry_conditions: BTC 7-day Implied Volatility / BTC 7-day Realized Volatility < 1.10
High-impact US macroeconomic event scheduled in 1-3 trading days
BTC price is within +/- 8% of its 20-day moving average

exit_conditions.take_profit: IV/RV ratio reaches 1.30 or event concludes (whichever comes first)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 15% depreciation of volatility premium (theta decay impact)
exit_conditions.time_exit: At market close on the day of the scheduled event

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: IV fails to expand relative to RV in the 3 days leading into the event more than 40% of the time.
